isis.stitle: TSI 06-12-06 - In-Chassis Service Procedure: Removal and Installation of Branch Tube Assembly

subjectgroup.subject: In-Chassis Service Procedure: Removal and Installation of Branch Tube Assembly

geninfo.para: This In-chassis Service Procedure allows removal of the branch tube assembly without removing the cylinder heads.

note.para: Photo illustrations in this TSI identify specific parts or assemblies that support text and procedures; other areas in photo illustrations may not be exact.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, shift transmission to park or neutral, set parking brake, and block wheels before doing diagnostic or service procedures.
To prevent personal injury or death, make sure the engine has cooled before removing components.

To prevent personal injury or death, do not let engine fluids stay on your skin. Clean skin and nails with hand cleaner and soap and water. Wash or dispose of clothing and rags contaminated with engine fluids.

note.para: Engine fluids (oil, fuel, and coolant) are a threat to the environment. Recycle or dispose of engine fluids according to local regulations. Do not put engine fluids in the trash, on the ground, in sewers or bodies of water.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, always disconnect main negative battery cable first. Always connect the main negative battery cable last.

step1.para: Disconnect negative battery cable and Electronic Control Module (ECM) ground.
Remove air filter housing.
Remove air intake duct assembly.
Remove three M10 nuts holding exhaust down pipe to turbocharger exhaust flange.
Remove four M10 high temp bolts connecting exhaust tube assembly to turbocharger.
Loosen V-clamp connecting exhaust tube assembly to EGR cooler.
Remove four M8 bolts and nuts connecting exhaust tube assembly to left and right exhaust manifolds.
Remove exhaust tube assembly and EGR cooler gasket.
Remove the dual turbocharger. See EGES-300-1 Engine Service Manual - "Dual Turbocharger and Exhaust Tubing".
Unplug the EOT, EOP, Manifold Air Temperature (MAT), and Manifold Absolute Pressure (MAP) sensor connectors.
Loosen CAC intake duct clamps and remove CAC intake duct from the intake manifold.
Disconnect secondary fuel filter tubing. See EGES-300-1 Engine Service Manual - "Fuel System".
Remove the oil filter housing. See EGES-300-1 Engine Service Manual - "Oil Cooler and Filter Housing".
Rotate belt tensioner clockwise to release belt tension and remove serpentine drive belt.
Remove alternator wiring and remove alternator assembly.
Unplug vacuum hoses connected to the intake manifold.
Remove the Intake manifold and EGR cooler. See EGES-300-1 Engine Service Manual - "Manifolds and Exhaust Gas Recirculation (EGR)".
Remove the high-pressure oil pump cover. See EGES-300-1 Engine Service Manual - "High-pressure Oil Pump".
Remove the right and left cab mounts.
See EGES-300-1 Engine Service Manual- "Cylinder Head and Valve Train" to remove the following:
See EGES-300-1 Engine Service Manual- "In-chassis Service - Rocker Arm Replacement" to remove the following:

item.para: Rocker arm assemblies (intake and exhaust) for cylinders 5 and 6.

step1.para: Disconnect starter motor assembly wiring, remove three starter mounting bolts, and remove starter motor assembly.

caution.para: To prevent personal injury or death, use a suitable lifting device to support and lower transmission assembly.

step1.para: Remove transmission assembly. SeeTruck Service Manual.
Remove clutch assembly, if equipped with a manual transmission.
Remove flywheel or flex-plate. See EGES-300-1 Engine Service Manual - "Rear Cover".

caution.para: To prevent engine damage when removing the rear cover, avoid pulling out gasket between the upper and lower crankcase.

step1.para: Remove the rear cover. See EGES-300-1 Engine Service Manual - "Rear Cover".
Remove intake and exhaust pushrods from cylinders 5 and 6.
Remove exhaust pushrod from cylinder 4.
Attach a No. 27 torx bit to a 1/4 x 10 inch extension.
Look through back of crankcase and insert extension through exhaust pushrod hole for cylinder 4. Push torx bit into M6 x 40 torx bolt in block of branch tube assembly.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, do not drop mounting bolts into crankcase.

step1.para: Carefully loosen torx bolt to allow removal.
Remove extension from pushrod hole.
Look through back of crankcase and use a magnet to carefully remove torx bolt in one of three ways:

item.para: Magnet inserted through hole for crankcase-to-head tube
Magnet inserted through back of crankcase

step1.para: Insert extension through exhaust pushrod hole for cylinder 5. Push torx bit into M6 x 40 torx bolt in block of branch tube assembly.
Repeat steps 31 through 33.

figure.caption: Figure 3. Removal of bolts from branch tube adaptor

step1.para: Remove two M6 x 30 bolts connecting branch tube adapter to branch tube assembly.

figure.caption: Figure 4. Removal of branch tube adapter

step1.para: Remove branch tube adapter, using a No.10 quick release tool - ZTSE4581.
Remove O-ring from recess in branch tube assembly.

figure.caption: Figure 6. High-pressure oil pump assembly and STC fitting

step1.para: Remove STC fitting.
Remove branch tube assembly.

figure.caption: Figure 7. High-pressure oil pump assembly and STC fitting

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, a new STC fitting must be installed.

step1.para: Install a new STC fitting for the high-pressure oil pump.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, do not over tighten the STC fitting; if over tightened, the STC fitting will fail.

step1.para: Torque new STC fitting to 53 ± 4 N·m (39 ± 3 lbf·ft).

figure.caption: Figure 8. Mounting block on branch tube assembly

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, a new branch tube assembly must be installed.

step1.para: Grease each M6 x 40 torx bolt and insert into mounting blocks of new branch tube assembly.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, do not drop mounting bolts into crankcase.

step1.para: Position new branch tube assembly for mounting in crankcase.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, a new O-ring must be installed.

step1.para: Install new O-ring in the recess of the branch tube assembly.

figure.caption: Figure 10. Installation of bolts for branch tube adapter

step1.para: Install and loosely tighten two M6 x 30 mounting bolts to connect new branch tube adapter to branch tube assembly.
Look through back of crankcase, insert extension - with No. 27 torx bit attached - through exhaust pushrod hole for cylinder 4. Install and loosely tighten M6 x 40 torx bolt.
Look through back of crankcase, insert extension - with No. 27 torx bit attached - through exhaust pushrod hole for cylinder 5. Install and loosely tighten M6 x 40 torx bolt.
Torque both M6 x 40 torx bolts to 13 N·m (115 lbf·in).
Torque both M6 x 30 mounting bolts for the branch tube adaptor to 13 N·m (115 lbf·in).
Install exhaust pushrod for cylinder 4.
Install intake and exhaust pushrods for cylinders 5 and 6.
See EGES-300-1 Engine Service Manual- "In-chassis Service - Rocker Arm Replacement" to install the following:

item.para: Rocker arm assemblies (intake and exhaust) for cylinders 5 and 6.

step1.para: See EGES-300-1 Engine Service Manual- "Cylinder Head and Valve Train" to install the following:

figure.caption: Figure 12. Parts Identification (Engine In-chassis - CF chassis)

step1.para: Install the high-pressure oil pump cover. See EGES-300-1 Engine Service Manual - "High-pressure Oil Pump".
Install EGR cooler on intake manifold with new gaskets and O-ring seals. See EGES-300-1 Engine Service Manual- "Manifolds and Exhaust Gas Recirculation (EGR)".
Install the intake manifold. See EGES-300-1 Engine Service Manual - "Manifolds and Exhaust Gas Recirculation (EGR)".
Install the alternator assembly and reconnect alternator wiring. See Truck Service Manual.
Install serpentine drive belt.
Install the oil filter housing. See EGES-300-1 Engine Service Manual - "Oil Cooler and Filter Housing".
Reconnect secondary fuel filter tubing. See EGES-300-1 Engine Service Manual - "Fuel System".
Install the dual turbocharger. See EGES-300-1 Engine Service Manual - "Dual Turbocharger and Exhaust Tubing".
Plug in connectors for the EOT, EOP, MAT, and MAP sensors
Reconnect vacuum hoses to the intake manifold.
Install the air intake and CAC intake ducts. Tighten duct clamps.
Position exhaust tube assembly and new EGR cooler gasket on the engine. Install four M8 exhaust bolts and nuts finger tight to secure assembly to exhaust manifolds.
Install four M10 high temp bolts to connect exhaust tube assembly to the turbocharger.
Position V-clamp to connect exhaust tube assembly to the EGR cooler. Torque V-clamp to 12 ± 2 N·m (106 ± 17 lbf·in).
Torque four M10 high temp bolts connecting exhaust tube assembly to turbocharger to 49 N·m (36 lbf·ft)
Torque four M8 bolts securing exhaust tube assembly to both exhaust manifolds to 27 ± 4 N·m (20 ± 3 lbf·ft).
Install right and left cab mounts.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, do not reuse flywheel bolts

step1.para: See EGES-300-1 Engine Service Manual- "Rear Cover" for installation of the following:
Install starter motor assembly and torque two M8 x 40 bolts to 22-24 N·m (16-18 lbf·ft). Torque M12 x 45 starter bolt to 80-85 N·m (59-63 lbf·ft). Reconnect starter wiring.
Install clutch and pressure plate, if equipped with a manual transmission.

caution.para: To prevent personal injury or death, use a suitable lifting device to support and raise transmission assembly.

step1.para: Install transmission assembly. See Truck Service Manual.
Install exhaust down pipe onto turbocharger exhaust flange and torque three M10 nuts to 72 N·m (53 lbf·ft).
Install air filter housing.
Reconnect Electronic Control Module (ECM) ground and negative battery cable.
